ratings.comment: Spiotta is fantastic. I enjoyed lecture and always learned something new. Supportive of students and their question. There is a final paper due at the end, but the criteria and ability to choose your topic makes it enjoyable. Great feedback from Professor & TA on assignment and essay submissions. Would recommend anyone with interest take the class.

Dr. Marin-Spiotta is very enthusiastic about the field she studies. She is willing to answer all questions related to biogeography/ecology. This course involves a lot of reading (including social science and natural science), which is challenging, but the grading is not strict. Highly recommended for social science student as a elective.

Spiotta teaches the second half of GEOG120. She lectures at a faster pace than Williams, so that was quite the change mid-semester. She is very interested in Geomorphology and land surfaces and it shows in her lectures. Exams are lecture heavy but manageable. I learned a lot and found the class very interesting.

She taught the second half of geog 120, and I thought she did a really good job. The tests were really easy, and the homework and lectures were interesting. I would recommend this professor/class to anyone.

Professor Marin-Spiotta was a good lecturer and was very knowledgeable about the content. DON'T BUY THE TEXTBOOK, the tests are (from what I could tell) 100% made up from stuff she put on lecture slides. You should be able to get a good grade in this class as long as you put some time into the assignments and STUDY for the tests!!

She is well-spoken and good at making things interesting. Her half of the class is both easier and more interesting, in my opinion. She's so nice and she's so excited about the subject and about her work.

Erika was super nice and clearly passionate about the material. However, it was not super necessary to attend lecture bc the slides are posted online. Also, the TAs summarized lectures in discussion section. The tests were super fair. Overall, very interesting class. Erika's portion of the class focused on soil which she managed to make pretty cool

Professor Marin-Spiotta was a really passionate professor and her lectures were awesome. Her slides and pictures were really helpful for exams and it was easy to follow her material. I did so much better when she taught the second half of the semester.

Professor Marin-Spiotta's lectures were very interesting. She explains topics quite well. I took this class synchronously online. She did an excellent job keeping students engaged, despite the online aspect. I had her for GEOG120 in the past in person as well and I would recommend taking that class with her as well.
She was able to make me get more interested with the subject
Not really my discipline, but overall, I can say that I enjoyed this class. Lectures can get long, but she keeps it interesting with her excellent use of powerpoints.

Erika really cares about what she teaches and she genuinely cares for students and their grade in her class. You can tell she enjoys the course material and is very knowledgeable. I love taking classes with her as the professor.
Goes kind of fast through her slides. Makes the lectures interesting, as much as she can.
Listen in class and remember a couple examples from discussions.  She gives an exam review sheet with everything she would possibly ask on the exam.  Review these questions and you'll get an A.
Sometimes she goes through things a little fast. Tests are pretty easy and straight from lecture- textbook is not important at all for her section of the class.

Professor was passionate about the subject but lectures were disorganized. Readings weren't useful as the exams were completely based off of lecture. Definitely one of the easiest classes I've taken at college, especially for a science class.
Good professor for 120 and 338. Interesting classes, and easy if you go to lecture and pay attention.

THIS IS NOT AN EASY A. I was a 4.0 student until this class. Reading isn't necessary(or even helpful). Just study the lecture slides and bold words in the book and you'll get a B, no doubt.  She's a great teacher. I learned incredibly well from her, but my grade was severely damaged thanks to the first half of semester, not taught by her.

Easiest class I have ever taken at UW-Madision.  It's extremely boring, especially discussion sections, but soooooo easy. Makes more sense to go to lecture because some stuff she says isn't on the slides, but all the material is in the book also.  Take if you want the easiest A of your life.

She knows her stuff and explained concepts clearly, but lectures were generally quite dry. Don't waste your money on the textbook. This class is very boring if you have any amount of natural science background.
I liked Erika better than the other lecturer for this class, but sometimes she didn't make things as clear as she could've.  Also, the exams could be tricky.

Tag-team lecture.  Marin-Spiotta is a much less engaging lecturer than the other professor.  Obviously knows her stuff, but lectures became far less helpful, clear, and entertaining when she took over.

Professor Marin-Spiotta was not was interesting or engaging as Jim Burt (prof for the first half of the semester), but she was not horribly boring either. Exams were based on lecture, but she didn't necessarily spend a whole lot of time on material that was on the exam. Not necessarily an easy A by any means.
She was not super clear at times, but she always did her best to make sure we all understood key concepts and definitely seemed invested in us and our grades. Tests were pretty straightforward.
She is the worst prof ever.She not just telling things with non sense but also teaching with misleading information.
